wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Elam Haigh (1855–1905) was an English classical scholar.

response: * Arthur Elam Haigh, 1878S. J. Low, 'Haigh, Arthur Elam (1855–1905)', rev. Richard Smail, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004

*1876: Arthur Elam Haigh (Corpus Christi) for tragic iambics: Shakespeare's Julius Caesar, Act 1, Sc. 2.Haigh, Arthur Elam, Gaisford Prize: Greek Verse (Oxford: Thos. Shrimpton & Son, 1876), online at books.google.co.uk, accessed 14 August 2008
*1877: Arthur Elam Haigh for The Popish Plot, in the style of Thucydides.
